page.title: 08Peat
page.content: Mr Brown of Kirkpatrick Durham has a peat business. He cuts the peat about 20 miles away from the village at a place called Glenshimeroch. It is cut by a machine that runs off a tractor. There is a sort of dredger at the back of the machine. It goes down into the peat. The peat is then taken up and dumped in a sort of compressor. It is then squashed out through tubes at the back. When the sun dries it up it cracks into separate pieces. People are then employed for the summer to bag it. They are usually children but sometimes grans and grampas come to help. They get 10p a bag. Mr Brown and two men that are employed full time then go round villages and towns in a lorry and sell the peat.
